volunteer_experiences.role: Treasurer and Trustee on the Board of Trustees
volunteer_experiences.description:
New Zealand's largest outdoor sculpture gallery. The Waikato Sculpture Trust is dedicated to inspire creativity and the promote contemporary outdoor sculpture in New Zealand.

In this role, Elisa began as a volunteer Park Guide, educating weekend visitors about the history of Waitakaruru Arboretum, as well as providing education on the current Sculpture exhibition and the role of the Sculpture Trust within the Abororetum. 

Proving to be a reliable, loyal and enthusiastic member, the Board approached Elisa to take on the role of Treasurer and to become a Trustee of the Waikato Sculpture Trust Board. Elisa's professional background as an Accountant was well suited to the Treasurer role. 

Duties included monitoring financial performance and position and providing a Treasurer's report and advice to the Board regarding financial matters at regular Trustee meetings. Additionally, the Treasurer oversaw the annual financial statement compilation process. The Treasurer was also required to oversee implementation of other legal projects such as a License to Occupy. Above all, as a Trustee, Elisa had fiducial duties to the Trust and its Beneficiaries. 

Carved into a Waikato hillside, The Sculpture Park at Waitakaruru Arboretum is a former quarry that has been transformed into a magnificent 17.5 hectare garden and arboretum. The rehabilitation started in 1991 to enhance the existing features: rocky outcrops, ponds, flowing water and broad vistas.

Located in Gurgaon, India, Fundacja Aravindam is an NGO active in the fields of education and environment.

Elisa volunteered at the schools under the umbrella of Fundacja Aravindam, Lotus Feet School and Gurukul Kalpataru School. Elisa's role included teaching subjects such as English, Mathematics, and Geography to the children of the school. Elisa's role was also to demonstrate new teaching methods and activites to other volunteers and teachers. While teaching at the schools, Elisa developed rapport with the students, providing them with care and patience. 

Aravindam’s mission is to facilitate growth and development of underprivileged communities in the field of education and environment, by involving volunteers and donors in impactful projects.

Aravindam’s social initiative in India focuses on areas where the contribution can create a lasting impact on the environment and people it serves. This is a journey of realization for all individuals involved under Aravindam’s motto ‘ To Serve -To Learn – To Grow’…!

The foundation’s main focus areas are :

Education: 
The objective of the Education Program is to provide an all round personality development and create the platform where children and youth attain skills and confidence to grow in life on their own merit. The core principle is to stimulate free and independent thinking in the minds of the young learners through innovative methods.

Environment: 
The objective of the Environment Program is to make the environment nicer for flora, fauna, and the people. Fundacja Aravindam is engaging in environment protection and conservation activities in Indian communities. This includes tree plantation, protection of native vegetation, water conservation and water harvesting.

Volunteering:
The objective of the Volunteering Program is to provide life enhancing experience to international and local volunteers desiring positive change, personal and intercultural skills development and self-realization.
